titleStmt.title: An elegy upon the unfortunate death of Captain William Bedloe, who departed this life, on Fryday the twentieth of August. 1680.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for John Gay, at the Flying-Horse between St. Dunstan's Church and Chancery-Lane.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "How fickle is the state of all mankind? ..."
Within mourning borders, with emblems and motto.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Flying-Horse between St. Dunstan's Church
